attributes.action: to explain from its own assessment the risks, and guaranteed benefits from creating 'true' hybrid embryos from mixing of human and animal gametes.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The Human Tissue and Embryology Bill (currently before Parliament) will pave the way for scientists to create a variety of embryos made up of of different species. 

People are opposed to the extreme legislation being proposed(only Canada allows research currently). The UK public have been kept in the dark e.g. a managed low profile in the mass media. In the longer term, we face the dilemma of what it will mean to be 'human'. This research will also increase the risk of animal suffering as the natural barriers between animals and humans are removed e.g. greater experimentation with ' animals' to satisfy research. N.B. Reliable alternative research is available e.g. adult cells for stem cell research. 
For the government to proceed with this legislation without clear explanation of the benefits and risks is simply outrageous. Before legalising research that threatens the future of the human race as we know it, the government must facilitate a proper debate, engaging fully with the the British public.
